# Change prefix from Ctrl+b to Ctrl+a (easier to reach)
unbind C-b
set-option -g prefix C-a
bind-key C-a send-prefix

# Split panes using | and -
bind | split-window -h
bind - split-window -v
unbind '"'
unbind %

# Reload config
bind r source-file ~/.tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"

# Enable mouse mode
set -g mouse on

# Start window numbering at 1
set -g base-index 1
setw -g pane-base-index 1

# Increase scrollback buffer
set-option -g history-limit 10000

# Status bar customization
set -g status-style bg=colour234,fg=colour137
set -g status-left '[#S] '
set -g status-right '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M'
set -g status-right-length 50
set -g status-left-length 20

# Highlight active window
setw -g window-status-current-style fg=colour81,bg=colour238,bold

# Pane borders
set -g pane-border-style fg=colour238
set -g pane-active-border-style fg=colour81

# Vi mode for copy
setw -g mode-keys vi
EOF
AGENT: '  - Use Ctrl+a instead of Ctrl+b'

#!/bin/bash
tmux new-session -d -s dev
tmux rename-window -t dev:0 'editor'
tmux send-keys -t dev:0 'cd ~/project && vim' C-m

tmux new-window -t dev:1 -n 'server'
tmux split-window -h -t dev:1
tmux send-keys -t dev:1.0 'cd ~/project && npm run dev' C-m
tmux send-keys -t dev:1.1 'cd ~/project && tail -f logs/app.log' C-m

tmux new-window -t dev:2 -n 'database'
tmux send-keys -t dev:2 'psql myapp' C-m

tmux attach-session -t dev
EOF
